hints.content: For fractions to be equivalent, they must represent the same area of the whole.
Let's use a visual model to see which fractions shade the same area of the whole as $\blueD{\dfrac{1}{4}}$.

![rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth. same sized rectangle below it, with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 fourth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ce9129276c3b04d50ab812d6252f7e61d3266c71)

$\blueD{\dfrac{1}{4}} \neq \greenD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

![rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth. same sized rectangle below it, with 1 of 2 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 half](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f683e81f4c3ef963025d099aaf07b04bdbf07d01)

$\blueD{\dfrac{1}{4}} \neq \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}$

![rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth. same sized rectangle below it, with 2 of 8 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 eighth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a05cf15f1c809c841c21b5fdb458432e0c18ce87)

$\blueD{\dfrac{1}{4}} = \purpleD{\dfrac{2}{8}}$

The following fraction is equivalent to $\blueD{\dfrac14}$:

- $\purpleD{\dfrac{2}{8}}$

question.content:
**Which of the following fractions are equivalent to $\dfrac14$?**
